intro: Quercus tarokoensis f. rugosa, commonly known as the Taroko oak var. rugosa, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rugged, and thickened bark. The leaves are typically broad,革质 (leathery), and have a serrated margin, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in mountainous regions with high altitude and cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
